data.enText: vehicle accident
wreck
an accident in which a vehicle hits sth, for example another vehicle, usually causing damage and often injuring or killing the passengers

data.chText: 昨天有一女孩在一桩涉及窃车的撞车事故中丧生。
data.enText: A girl was killed yesterday in a crash involving a stolen car.

data.chText: 汽车撞车事故；飞机失事
data.enText: a car/plane crash
loud noise

data.chText: （倒下、破碎等突然的）碰撞声，破裂声，碎裂声
data.enText: a sudden loud noise made, for example, by sth falling or breaking
The tree fell with a great crash.

data.chText: 远处的第一声霹雳震撼着天空。
data.enText: The first distant crash of thunder shook the air.
in finance/business
a sudden serious fall in the price or value of sth; the occasion when a business, etc. fails
the 1987 stock market crash
computing

data.chText: （机器或系统，尤指计算机或计算机系统的）崩溃
data.enText: a sudden failure of a machine or system, especially of a computer or computer system
of vehicle
if a vehicle crashes or the driver crashes it, it hits an object or another vehicle, causing damage

data.chText: 飞机会失事把我吓坏了。
data.enText: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
We're going to crash, aren't we?

data.chText: 货车失控撞上了一辆公共汽车的尾部。
data.enText: A truck went out of control and crashed into the back of a bus.
He crashed his car into a wall.
hit hard/loud noise
to hit sth hard while moving, causing noise and/or damage; to make sth hit sb/sth in this way

data.chText: 砖块哗啦一声砸入了窗户。
data.enText: A brick crashed through the window.

data.chText: 他一挥手把眼镜碰到地上摔碎了。
data.enText: With a sweep of his hand he sent the glasses crashing to the floor.

data.chText: 那门砰的一声给砸开了。
data.enText: The door crashed open.

data.chText: 她愤怒地冲出房间并随手把门砰的一声关上。
data.enText: She stormed out of the room and crashed the door shut behind her.
to make a loud noise
Thunder crashed overhead.
in finance/business

before.enText: of prices, a business, shares, etc.

data.enText: to lose value or fail suddenly and quickly

data.chText: 昨天股票价格暴跌到了前所未有的最低纪录。
data.enText: Share prices crashed to an all-time low yesterday.

data.chText: 那家公司由于负债5 000万英镑而告破产。
data.enText: The company crashed with debts of £50 million.
computing
if a computer crashes or you crash a computer, it stops working suddenly

data.chText: 要是计算机系统突然崩溃，文件就可能丢失。
data.enText: Files can be lost if the system suddenly crashes.
party
in sport
to lose very badly in a sports game

data.chText: 那支队遭受了本赛季最严重的一次惨败。
data.enText: The team crashed to their worst defeat this season.
sleep

data.chText: 入睡；（在不常睡觉的地方）睡觉
data.enText: to fall asleep; to sleep somewhere you do not usually sleep

data.chText: 我累极了，在沙发上就睡着了。
data.enText: I was so tired I crashed out on the sofa.

data.chText: 我来你家打几个晚上的地铺。
data.enText: I've come to crash on your floor for a couple of nights.
medical
if sb crashes , their heart stops beating
a crashing bore
a very boring person
crash out (of sth)
to lose a game with the result that you have to stop playing in a competition

data.chText: 他们以1:2输给巴西之后在世界杯赛中被淘汰出局。
data.enText: They crashed out of the World Cup after a 2-1 defeat to Brazil.
involving hard work or a lot of effort over a short period of time in order to achieve quick results
a crash course in computer programming
a crash diet

data.chText: 以上各词均含碰撞、撞击之义，尤指撞车。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when sth, especially a vehicle, hits sth else very hard and is damaged or destroyed.
crash

data.chText: 指（使）物体或交通工具碰撞或撞击：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to hit an object or another vehicle, causing damage; to make a vehicle do this

data.chText: 飞机会失事把我吓坏了。
data.enText: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
slam (sth) into/against sb/sth
to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this

data.chText: 汽车打滑，重重地撞到树上。
data.enText: The car skidded and slammed into a tree.
collide

data.chText: 指交通工具或人碰撞、相撞或撞上：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) (of two vehicles or people) to crash into each other; (of a vehicle or person) to crash into sb/sth else

data.chText: 那辆小轿车和货车在浓雾中迎面相撞。
data.enText: The car and the van collided head-on in thick fog.
smash

data.chText: 指（使）猛烈撞击、猛烈碰撞或撞车：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this; to crash a car

data.chText: 飙车抢劫者驾着偷来的汽车撞破商店橱窗。
data.enText: Ramraiders smashed a stolen car through the shop window.

data.chText: crash尤指交通工具碰撞，可不与介词连用：
data.enText: Crash is used particularly for vehicles and can be used without a preposition.
We're going to crash, aren't we?

data.chText: slam和smash表示此义时总是与介词连用：
data.enText: In this meaning slam and smash always take a preposition.
We're going to slam/smash, aren't we?

data.chText: 两词均可用于除交通工具外的范围更广的事物。crash与介词连用也可用于其他事物：
data.enText: They are used for a much wider range of things than just vehicles. Crash can also be used for other things, if used with a preposition.

data.chText: 他砰的一声将电话听筒摔下来。
data.enText: He crashed down the telephone receiver.
crash, slam or smash?
wreck

data.chText: 指使交通工具撞坏或毁坏
data.enText: to crash a vehicle and damage it so badly that it is not worth repairing
The two vehicles crashed/collided.
The two vehicles crashed/slammed/smashed into each other .
The car/plane crashed/slammed/smashed into a tree.
I've crashed/smashed/wrecked the car .
to crash/slam/collide/smash head-on (into/with sth)

means: (倒下、破碎等突然的)碰撞声，破裂声，碎裂声

ex.enText: Be careful not to bump your head.
She bumped her arm on the tree.
The car bumped into the telegraph pole.

synonyms.bx: 指人体某一部分不小心被撞伤，也指具体东西猛烈地碰撞。

ex.chText: 两辆重型卡车在街角处相撞。
ex.enText: Two heavy trucks collided with each other at the street corner.

ex.chText: 这两大党派的利益相互冲突。
ex.enText: The interests of the two parties collided.

synonyms.bx: 通常指人或物在运动中与反方向的人或物相撞；也可指在某一问题上产生矛盾冲突。

ex.chText: 劫匪驾车撞上了一堵墙。
ex.enText: The robber crashed the car into a wall.

ex.chText: 飞机起飞后不久便坠毁了。
ex.enText: The plane crashed soon after take-off.

synonyms.bx: 指车辆、飞机等猛烈撞击障碍物、地面等，常伴有毁灭性的后果。

ex.chText: 他从自行车上摔下来，伤了脚踝。
ex.enText: He fell off the bike and jarred his ankle.

ex.chText: 我准是在打篮球时伤了手臂。
ex.enText: I must have jarred my arm playing basketball.

data.enText: a crashing bore
a very boring person
crash out (of sth)
to lose a game with the result that you have to stop playing in a competition

data.chText: 他们以1:2输给巴西之后在世界杯赛中被淘汰出局。
data.enText: They crashed out of the World Cup after a 2-1 defeat to Brazil.

trans: （因极度困倦或醉酒而）入睡，睡觉

tr: the act of colliding with something
example: his crash through the window
the fullback's smash into the defensive line

tr: a serious accident (usually involving one or more vehicles)
example: they are still investigating the crash of the TWA plane
he could hear the clang of distant bells

tr: a sudden large decline of business or the prices of stocks (especially one that causes additional failures)
(computer science) an event that causes a computer system to become inoperative
example: the crash occurred during a thunderstorm and the system has been down ever since
You can crash here, though it's not very comfortable
My computer crashed last night
The system goes down at least once a week

tr: undergo a sudden and severe downturn
example: the economy crashed
will the stock market crash again?
He dashed the plate against the wall
Waves were dashing against the rock

tr: undergo damage or destruction on impact
example: the plane crashed into the ocean
The car crashed into the lamp post
The terrorists crashed the plane into the palace
Mother crashed the motorbike into the lamppost
The branch crashed down on my car
The plane crashed in the sea
let's crash the party!

tr: move violently as through a barrier
example: The terrorists crashed the gate

tr: move with, or as if with, a crashing noise
example: The car crashed through the glass door
the waves crashed on the shore and kept us awake all night
My son's friends crashed our house last weekend

value.def: A crash is an accident in which a moving vehicle hits something and is damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: His elder son was killed in a car crash a few years ago.
example.tran: 他的长子几年前死于车祸。

value.def: If a moving vehicle crashes or if the driver crashes it, it hits something and is damaged or destroyed.

example.ex: The plane crashed mysteriously near the island of Ustica.
example.tran: 那架飞机在乌斯蒂卡岛附近神秘坠毁了。

example.ex: ...when his car crashed into the rear of a van...
example.tran: 他的车撞进一辆货车尾部的时候

example.ex: Even his death, after crashing his motorcycle on a bridge in New Orleans, was spectacular...
example.tran: 甚至他骑摩托车在新奥尔良撞桥身亡的事也轰动一时。

example.ex: Her body was found near a crashed car.
example.tran: 在一辆撞毁的汽车旁发现了她的尸体。

value.def: If something crashes somewhere, it moves and hits something else violently, making a loud noise.

example.ex: The door swung inwards to crash against a chest of drawers behind it...
example.tran: 门朝里摆去，撞到了后面的大衣柜。

example.ex: My words were lost as the walls above us crashed down, filling the cellar with brick dust...
example.tran: 我们头顶的墙塌了下来，地下室里满是砖灰，我惊得说不出话来。

example.ex: I heard them coming, crashing through the undergrowth, before I saw them.
example.tran: 还没看到他们，我便听到他们穿过矮树丛过来的声音。

value.def: A crash is a sudden, loud noise.

example.ex: Two people in the flat recalled hearing a loud crash about 1.30 a.m.
example.tran: 公寓楼里有两个人回想起凌晨1点半听见了一声巨响。

value.def: If a business or financial system crashes, it fails suddenly, often with serious effects.

example.ex: When the market crashed, they assumed the deal would be cancelled.
example.tran: 当市场崩溃时，他们认为交易会被取消。

example.ex: He predicted correctly that there was going to be a stock market crash.
example.tran: 他准确地预测到股市即将崩盘。

value.tran: (生意或金融体制)倒闭，破产，失败

value.def: If a computer or a computer program crashes, it fails suddenly.

example.ex: ...after the computer crashed for the second time in 10 days.
example.tran: 电脑在10天内第二次死机后

value.tran: (计算机或计算机程序)崩溃，瘫痪

trans: 闪电崩盘；闪电暴跌；快闪跌市；闪电跌市；闪电崩溃
车毁人亡；撞车；车祸；汽车相撞事故
崩溃恢复；实例恢复；故障修复；故障恢复；应急修复
应急时间；赶工时间；撞击时间；撞车时刻；冲撞时刻
股灾；股市崩盘；大崩盘；股市崩溃
